target.name: help
target.echo: A few questions related to your local environment.
This Phing will best work when having a local Virtual Host (and is not under localhost for instance)
Enter your local domain without 'www', e.g. example.lan.
Enter the path where to find the database credentials relative to me. Default: configuration/Settings.php
Do you want to configure phing to fetch the website from a remote server? Enter true or false. Default: true

then.echo: A few questions related to your remote server. Enter values if previously enter true for has.server.deployment
Enter the SSH credentials to the server if relevant. Ex. user@domain.com
Enter the home directory on the remote (without the trailing slash), e.g /sites/domain.com
Enter the path where to find the database credentials relative to remote.directory.home. Default: configuration/Settings.php

target.echo: [NOTICE] A new file "configuration/PhingSettings.xml" has just been generated.
It may be a good idea to have a look at it and personalise it a bit...
Once being checked, run again this phing. It should look different.
